snippet: The attack, determined to be arson, reinforced fears of potential violence as a polarizing and racially charged presidential race nears its conclusion....
abstract: African-American church in Greenville, Miss, is deliberately set ablaze and spray painted with 'Vote Trump' slogan, raising fears of violent clashes in days surrounding highly contentious presidential election; officials decline to confirm whether crime, which echoes racist church bombings of civil rights era, was politically motivated.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and RICHARD FAUSSET
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Greenville, and Richard Fausset from Chapel Hill, N.C.

lead_paragraph: The attack, determined to be arson, reinforced fears of potential violence as a polarizing and racially charged presidential race nears its conclusion.

headline.main: Black Church Burned in Mississippi, With ‘Vote Trump’ Scrawled on Side
headline.print_headline: Black Church Is Burned in Mississippi, With ‘Vote Trump’ Scrawled on Side
